items.item_details:
The Board of Trustees offers an opportunity for the public to address the Board in four sections of the agenda: on matters of concern about Closed Session items; on matters not appearing on the agenda; on action items contained in the Consent Agenda; and prior to voting on any item contained in the Action Agenda. Each speaker is encouraged to submit a comment card to the Board clerk in order to be recognized to speak.
	Per Board Policy, three minutes may be allotted to each speaker with a maximum of 30 minutes per subject. No action or discussion shall be undertaken on any public comments except that members of the Board or its staff may briefly respond to or ask a question for clarification regarding statements made or questions posed by persons addressing the Board under this agenda item.
	For information and disability access to materials, call 408-270-6402. Meetings are held in a location accessible to the disabled.

items.item_details:
Per the collective bargaining agreement between the Faculty Association AFT 6157 and San Jose/Evergreen Community College District Article 9.19 submission and recommendation: Adjunct faculty members shall be responsible and accountable for all District assigned services during the college semester for which they are employed. Assignments are limited to a maximum of 67% of the full load.
Article 9.19 ASSIGNMENT LENGTH AND MAXIMUM LOADING - Adjunct faculty members shall be responsible and accountable for all District assigned service during the college semester for which they are employed. Assignments are limited to a maximum of 67% of a full load.
Therefore, the attached information is in compliance with Article 9.19 of the Faculty Association AFT 6157 Collective Bargaining Agreement with San Jose/Evergreen Community College District.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the faculty personnel action as submitted.

items.item_details: The District employs non-bargaining unit employees in various categories to support programs and services.  These categories are: short-term assignments with limitations as defined in the CSEA/District collective bargaining agreement; substitutes to fill positions for employees on leave of absence or in vacant positions; professional experts with specialized knowledge or expertise not generally required of, or found within, the employee classifications established by the Governing Board; and athletic support staff for athletic activities.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the Short-Term Hourly, Substitute, Professional Expert & Athletic Support Services, Student Assistant and Volunteer personnel actions as submitted.

items.item_text_raw: 6. Hourly, Student Work & Volunteer Personnel Actions

items.item_details:
The purpose of this study abroad trip to Belize and Guatemala is to grant an opportunity to travel abroad to those who might not otherwise have such an opportunity.  This includes economically disadvantaged students, students of color, and students who are single parents attending Evergreen Valley College and San Jose City College.  The primary objective is to globalize their understanding of the western world historically, culturally, geographically, and economically. Students will be required register in three units of college coursework (i.e. African American History or Introduction to Social and Cultural Anthropology) during the summer of 2014 that will include a service learning portion for those students traveling to Belize and Guatemala.   Prior to the trip, students will receive numerous lectures on world history, global economics and geography.  While on the study abroad tour students will receive numerous lectures and field study projects from university faculty.
	 
Students participating will be Rebecca Bruno, Dominik Curless, Catia Goode, Jeremiah Hodge, Marilyn Muniz, Ryan Murphy, Mariel Navarro, Derrick Newton, Jasmine Panit, Angelica Rodriguez, Kevin Stanley, Chad Stewart, Christine Telez, and Jordan Vukosav. Students will be accompanied by faculty members, Keenan Norris, Flora Payne, Bobby Seals, and Khalid White.  The students and faculty will leave San Francisco on Sunday, July 27, 2014 and will be returning on Wednesday, August 6, 2014. The estimated cost for travel is $43,200 ($2,400 per person). Students and faculty will be paying for half of their trip, with the remaining balance collected through fundraising. Students will take priority in regards to fundraising efforts.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve out of country travel for Evergreen Valley College and San Jose City College students and faculty.
items.item_text: Out of Country Travel for Students and Faculty
items.item_text_raw: 7. Out of Country Travel for Students and Faculty

items.item_details:
This is a new board policy for the District in response to the needs of financial services to ensure that a clear policy on the issuance and responsibility of procurement (credit) cards for district purposes is available, known, and adhered to by those employees who have been issued a procurement (credit) card.
	 
The timeline below details the review process of the attached board policy:
	 
October 17, 2013:  Presented to District Council as a "first read" and for subsequent dissemination to constituent groups.
November 21, 2013:  Second read at District Council (final input and suggestions/changes made).
January 14, 2014:  "First read" to the Board of Trustees.
	 
Based upon the above review and consultation, it is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve Board Policy 6331.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Board Policy 6331 Procurement (Credit) Cards.

items.item_details: The revisions in the attached Conflict of Interest Code 2014 are a result of the additions of two positions, elimination of three positions listed in the 2012 code, and a change of title for a required filing position. At the February 12, 2013, meeting, the Board of Trustees approved the hiring of the Director of Human Resource; and this position is being added as a required filer. At the November 12, 2013, board meeting, the Board of Trustees approved the creation of the Vice Chancellor, Information Technology (CISO) position. Although the district has not yet hired an individual for the position, it is important to add this position to our updated code. On November, 26, 2013, the district hired a Director of Facilities and Bond Program; and this position is a required filer. The district has also eliminated the Director of Bookstore Operations, Director of Employee Services (now the Director of Human Resources), and Director of Information Technology (now the Vice Chancellor, Information Technology.) Because of these changes, it is recommended that the Board of Trustees approve the revised Conflict of Interest Code. A redlined and clean copy version is attached to this agenda item for the review of the Board. After the Board approves the revised code, it will be forwarded to the Santa Clara County Office to be approved by the Santa Clara County Board of Supervisors.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve a revision to the district's Conflict of Interest Code.

items.item_details: The San Jose Evergreen Community College District Foundation established by the Board of Trustees is building a platform upon which to enhance the district's image in order to strengthen our ability to generate critical resources and develop new avenues of charitable giving. On an annual basis, the Foundation reports on its fiscal and programmatic activities. Since the last report to the Board of Trustees, the Foundation has accomplished many of its 2013 goals and has established new goals for 2014 which will further the Foundationâs purpose of on-going support to both campuses.
items.item_text: SJECCD Foundation Annual Report
items.item_text_raw: 1. SJECCD Foundation Annual Report

items.item_details:
Pursuant to Education Code 84040.3, each organization that is described in Section 501(c)3 of the Internal Revenue Code that is recognized by the governing board of a community college district as having a formal relationship with and that is working on behalf of the district or a community college within the district shall file a copy of its audited financial report for the previous fiscal year with the governing board on or before April 1 of each year.
	 
The Foundation Board of Directors took action to receive the audited financial statements for the years ending June 30, 2012 and 2013 and the Statement of Auditing Standards at their meeting of January 23, 2014.  
	 
Accordingly, the report for the San Jose Evergreen Community College District Foundation is provide for the Board of Trustees' information.

items.item_text_raw: 2. San Jose Evergreen Community College District Foundation Independent Annual Financial Report for Fiscal Years 2011-2012 and 2012-2013

items.item_details: On January 11, 2013, the Board of Trustees reviewed a draft document of proposed board governance policies resulting from the Carver Governance Model Study Session conducted on December 13, 2013.  Board members were asked to review the draft and to submit edits to staff for the development of a composite new draft.  This information item represents the public venue for the discussion of the composite changes to the Proposed Policy. The composite working draft will be distributed at the meeting to the Board and members of the audience. This working draft will also be attached to this board agenda item at the time of the meeting.
items.item_text: Blitz Policy Development Continuation (1 hour)
items.item_text_raw: 3. Blitz Policy Development Continuation (1 hour)

items.item_details:
On January 11, 2013, the Board of Trustees announced its intent to adopt a new governance policy model.  Discussion ensued on the components of the model and the proposed governance policies that would be recommended for adoption under that model.  The board made it clear that this process was strictly the work in their intent to establish operating procedures that would enable them to function in a more effective and efficient manner as a policy board.  Nevertheless, the board recognized the importance of ensuring that constituent groups were clear about the reasons for undertaking this process, the key components of the proposed model, and the steps that would be necessary in order to adopt a new governance framework. 
	 
Staff was asked to facilitate a districtwide survey including students, faculty and staff designed to identify key questions and concerns regarding the proposed governance model.  In addition, the survey included the language for the proposed governance policies inviting individuals to raise questions and concerns as appropriate.  Staff has prepared a summary document using a Q&A Format designed to facilitate discussion and interaction with constituent groups.
items.item_text: Public Discussion: Question and Answers Session on the Carver Policy Governance Model (1 hour)
items.item_text_raw: 4. Public Discussion: Question and Answers Session on the Carver Policy Governance Model (1 hour)
